title: Lore Timeline of League of Legends
body:
Hey guys,
for a long time i wondered when each of the major events in the league lore took place. We have so many regions and civilisations that it is sometimes confusing as what happened first.
For example, were the watchers in freljord trapped in the howling abyss before the ruination of the shadow isles?
So after reading here on the board, that it was confirmed, that shurimas fall, the darkin wars, and the rune wars happened in that order. I wanted to make a bigger timeline. I started to search for glues in the different Storys on the universe page, that say when something took place.
With that Information i created my own timeline.


- shurima founding (my starting point) 
- aurelion visits runterra again (he saw the construction of the sundisc in his Story)
- Doom of Icathia (since Setaka died on the eve of Icathias Doom and Setaka was ascended) 
- great void war (guess, but it is a probable reason that the doom of icathia was the reason) 
- creation of vastaya ("The vastaya’s origins can be traced back to a hidden corner of Ionia where a group of humans fled in escape of the Great Void War.")
- fall of shurima (millenia ago) 
- darkin wars (after fall of shurima confirmed boards)
- Morde gets his empire (in his bio its said that he has existed for countless centuries) 
- Morde falls 
- the freljordians are enslaved by the Watchers (in lyissandras lore it happened centuries ago) 
- watchers are defeated (lissandra said it happened Generations ago) 
- Noxus founding (confirmed after fall of Morde) 
- Rune wars (after darkin wars confirmed board) 
- Demacia founding (confirmed after rune wars in Galios bio) 
- Ruination of the blessed isles (~100 years ago, confirmed by Yoricks short story) 
- Rise of Shurima 


Would be nice if you guys could Point out any mistakes i may have made, or help me expand the timeline. 
Or if an official Rioter could confirm if it's accurate or not.

I highly doubt that the Ruination happened before the rise of Noxus. The early Noxian's took over the the Immortal Bastion after the Valoran Alliance finally slew Mordekaiser for the "last time" because the priests of the Blessed Isles successfully infiltrated the fortress and stole away Mordekaiser's skull so that he could no longer be resurrected. They then took that skull to the Blessed Isles where it sat guarded in the vault for centuries until the Ruination occurred, drawing Mordekaiser's lich servants to the isle like moths to a flame to resurrect their warlord once again. 

I'd say since at this point the city-state of Noxus would be a couple hundred years old, and then there is plenty of time between the Ruination occurring, multiple Harrowings, and the whispers of the Shadow Isles to spread to the city-state via word of mouth or the exploits of Elise at this point to draw Karthus to the island. There is no where in the lore that says Karthus was born shortly after the rise of Noxus. From what I gathered from his story, they already had taken over a good portion of the land surrounding the Immortal Bastion, and had created a culture and practice all their own.

I might have to go back and read the Shadow Isles lore real quick because I thought it was Hecarim, the leader of the King's Iron Legion that instigated the king into forcing the priests to resurrect his dead wife/queen.

Well locking away World Runes sure would keep the balance safe but I guess locking it in the same room with a guy in there 24/7 might not be the brightest idea yeah.

Hecarim tricked Kalista into bringing them to the Blessed Isles, started a slaughter to force the priests into telling him how to resurrect the king's wife, killed Kalista but Thresh was the one who lead them to the artifacts/fountain of life or whatever he led them to.

Threshs lore says that the artifacts in the Vault "spoke/tortured" him. And since Mordes skull was there maybe the skull "told" him what to do. His lich servants couldn't find the location of his skull thanks to the vault but if the vault would be destroyed.... I know that Thresh at some point got resistant to the artifacts and actually started torturing them. But the skull of Morde may have spoken to him only on this event? to make sure that Thresh never gets resistant to him.

Or maybe Thresh was just a mad bastard at that point.

I really like the whole theory of the timeline of the lore of LoL. But I have issues with the idea that Darkin War is between Shurima's fall and Rune Wars. I know it's basically set by the few instances recently mentioned by Rioters on the boards but some thing don't add up.

That being Varus' knowledge of it mainly. He mentions that not only was Shurima a wasteland (which doesn't mean a ruin, wasteland means nothing, meaning it might have been jut a desert so Darkin War long before Shurima even rose up) last he remembers but more importantly, people don't know what a Darkin is or that they 'all but destroyed this world' (Varus words). Why don't people know what Darkin's are? The guy writing about Vastayans and eyeing up Ahri mentioned that the Darkin were sentient weapons, not an entire race of invading near immortal beings that killed thousands. Is it so easily forgettable of a war? We, as humans, have on record nearly every major battle for the last 2000 years, some earlier through documentation. Did Runeterran's not document the Darkin War? 

Yet they remember Shurima, quite well it seems. Seems out of place.


Also, as Brand is mentioned in the Shurima lore, yet he has a World Rune it means world runes were known about long before the Rune Wars. 


Another thing, wasn't Aurelion Sol's story set recently? More recent that Shurima's sun disc was first constructed?  (as in after Azir arose) I might have misunderstood it but he closed a void breach and killed a Pantheon, meaning the other Aspects left over from the dead Targon Empire took notice and were to return to Runeterra because their grip on him was subsiding? No. Probably took that story all wrong.


Just some thoughts.
